grep: Enables colorized output for grep searches.
help-bash: Generates and caches one-line descriptions of aliases and functions from .bashrc using a local LLM.
ask: Sends a terminal question to a locally running Ollama model.
wifi-connect: Attempts to connect to a Wi-Fi network using nmcli with SSID and password.
wifi-on: Turns on Wi-Fi and sends a desktop notification.
wifi-off: Turns off Wi-Fi and sends a desktop notification.
wifi-status: Displays the status of Wi-Fi devices or shows a fallback message.
wifi-list: Lists nearby Wi-Fi networks using nmcli with paging.
wifi-current: Shows the SSID of the currently connected Wi-Fi or a fallback message.
typefetch: Prints three blank lines, then runs fastfetch with a custom logo and padding.
sbrc: Reloads the current shell with updated ~/.bashrc.
listports: Prints a formatted list of active JavaScript-related servers with PID, port, and command.
killport: Kills the process running on a specified port and displays the result.
ls: Lists all files and directories with details, icons, and ISO time format using exa.
lst: Displays a tree view of the current directory up to two levels deep using exa.
lsg: Shows files with Git status, icons, and grouping using exa.
lss: Lists files sorted by size with icons using exa.
lsd: Lists only directories in the current location using exa.
dsummary: Displays a summary of a directory's size, files, and subdirectories with colorized output.
hotspot: Enables 'hotspot.sh' script execution from anywhere in the filesystem.
flex: Displays system information with custom logo using 'fastfetch' command.
forceupdate: Updates the system packages with a force refresh.
man: Displays man pages using fzf and sorts unique commands alphabetically.
